title: Calories in a Slice of Cheese Pizza
meta_description: Discover calories in a slice of cheese pizza, including macros like protein, carbs, fat, and sodium, plus tweaks and FAQs for better choices.
h1: Calories in a Slice of Cheese Pizza
assumptions: Standard 14-inch pizza, one-eighth slice, mozzarella cheese topping, basic tomato sauce, medium crust; baked, no extra oil or toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, size, crust type, cheese amount, and baking method. Check labels or restaurant info when available.

quick_answer.text: A typical slice of cheese pizza contains about 285 calories and 12 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a slice of cheese pizza?
faqs.a: Approximately 285 kcal for a standard slice.

faqs.q: What's the protein in one slice of cheese pizza?
faqs.a: About 12 g of protein per slice.

faqs.q: Does cheese pizza have a lot of sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 640 mg per slice from cheese and sauce.

faqs.q: How do carbs break down in a cheese pizza slice?
faqs.a: Roughly 36 g total carbs, with 2 g fiber and 5 g sugars.

faqs.q: What affects calories in cheese pizza slices?
faqs.a: Crust thickness, cheese quantity, sauce, and portion size vary totals significantly.
